medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain started about 24 hours ago, initially as vague periumbilical pain that quickly worsened with radiation to the groin, RLQ, and epigastrium. Associated with subjective fevers, anorexia, multiple episodes of non-bloody emesis, PO intolerance, belching, little gas passing, diarrhea, and dysuria. Previously, there were two episodes of self-resolving LLQ abdominal pain.
